text: Turkey competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Artistic swimming== Turkey entered four artistic swimmers. ;Women {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Preliminaries !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Points !Rank !Points !Rank |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Defne Bakırcı |align=left|Solo technical routine |73.2867 |21 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|Solo free routine |74.5000 |26 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Defne Bakırcı Mısra Gündeş |align=left|Duet technical routine |76.1084 |26 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|Duet free routine |75.1667 |32 |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ;Mixed {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Preliminaries !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Points !Rank !Points !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Gökçe Akgün Rümeysa Ünal |align=left|Duet free routine |70.2000 |10 Q |70.9000 |10 |} ==Swimming== Turkey entered 15 swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;
